meanings.definition: To arrange or divide into layers
meanings.sent1: She carefully stratifies the colorful sand into distinct layers for her art project.
meanings.sent2: The geologist explained how the earth's crust stratifies over millions of years.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully stratifies the cake layers to create a visually appealing dessert.
meanings.sent4: As time passes, the sediment slowly stratifies, forming distinct rock layers.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting technique stratifies the colors beautifully, creating a mesmerizing effect.

meanings.definition: To separate into different social classes or levels
meanings.sent1: The strict school system stratifies students based on their academic performance.
meanings.sent2: In some societies, wealth stratifies people into distinct social classes.
meanings.sent3: The fictional kingdom stratifies its citizens based on their magical abilities.
meanings.sent4: The competitive nature of the industry stratifies employees into various levels of seniority.
meanings.sent5: The futuristic society in the novel stratifies individuals based on their genetic makeup.
